intro: Tarenna adamii var. nigeriana, commonly known as African star anise, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, dark-colored berries that are used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are often used for their aromatic properties in herbal remedies. The botanical features of this plant make it valuable in both medicinal and aromatic applications.
